reviews.snippet:
2 star more than enough for this restaurant.
As a tourist you never know what you get on the table. I ordered this. “I the only one who order this menu,” said the guy. Maybe I didn’t read good the menu. It’s cold and not watery. I thought ramen is ramen, but this is not. It’s like salads but with normal meet.  I asked to make it warm with warm water from ramen soup. It cannot, I have to order the new ramen soup. After all, I at it.
The price mention is all excluding tax.

reviews.snippet:
There are many mixed reviews we had about this place, while half of the family chose this as their #1 Halal ramen spot the other half felt like what they had was alright for a ramen spot.

We had the Wagyu Miso Ramen which had a thick broth and juicy piece of meat, as well as the Chicken Ramen with our own twist of having the broth be spicy.

Overall I do think you should visit the restaurant once, their selection of food in the menu is limited to ramen and a portion of fried chicken.

I do believe however, travelling is about tasting new foods and opening up to new cultures.
